payload: You can use the chocolate to figure out how many pieces of chocolates can fit along the width of the box.
How do I use the chocolate and box to do that?

To check how many chocolates would fit along the width of the box, take your chocolate and move it along the box. Use your pencil to help you mark on the box to see how many chocolates can be fit along the width.
I have a problem understanding that, what do I do with the pencil?
I think I can fit 5 of them
By sliding the chocolate along the length of the box and using the chocolate as a reference, you can find that the length would fit 10 chocolates.
